item.title: Dana add a quote by Che Elias
item.description: "...any schmoozer can light a candle." -- Che Elias

item.title: Dana add a quote by Victor Hugo
item.description: "Be like the bird that, passing on her flight awhile on boughs too slight, feels them give way beneath her, and yet sings, knowing that she hath wings." -- Victor Hugo

item.title: Dana add a quote by St. Francis Of Assisi
item.description: "No one is to be called an enemy, all are your benefactors, and no one does you harm. You have no enemy except yourselves." -- St. Francis Of Assisi

item.title: Dana add a quote by Rabindranath Tagore
item.description: "Death is not extinguishing the light; it is only putting out the lamp because the dawn has come." -- Rabindranath Tagore

item.title: Dana add a quote by Hermann Hesse
item.description: "Words do not express thoughts very well. They always become a little different immediately after they are expressed, a little distorted, a little foolish." -- Hermann Hesse

item.title: Dana add a quote by Ernesto "Che" Guevara
item.description: "Silence is argument carried out by other means." -- Ernesto "Che" Guevara

item.title: Dana add a quote by H. Jackson Brown, Jr.
item.description: "Approach love and cooking with reckless abandon" -- H. Jackson Brown, Jr.

item.title: Dana add a quote by Margaret Atwood
item.description: "In the spring, at the end of the day, you should smell like dirt." -- Margaret Atwood

item.title: Dana add a quote by Joseph Goldstein
item.description: "In India, I was living in a little hut, about six feet by seven feet. It had a canvas flap instead of a door. I was sitting on my bed meditating, and a cat wandered in and plopped down on my lap. I took the cat and tossed it out the door. Ten seconds later it was back on my lap. We got into a sort of dance, this cat and I...I tossed it out because I was trying to meditate, to get enlightened. But the cat kept returning. I was getting more and more irritated, more and more annoyed with the persistence of the cat. Finally, after about a half-hour of this coming in and tossing out, I had to surrender. There was nothing else to do. There was no way to block off the door. I sat there, the cat came back in, and it got on my lap. But I did not do anything. I just let go. Thirty seconds later the cat got up and walked out. So, you see, our teachers come in many forms." -- Joseph Goldstein

item.title: Dana add a quote by Oscar Wilde
item.description: "All bad poetry springs from genuine feeling. To be natural is to be obvious, and to be obvious is to be inartistic." -- Oscar Wilde

item.title: Dana add a quote by Aldous Huxley
item.description: "After silence, that which comes nearest to expressing the inexpressible is music." -- Aldous Huxley

item.title: Dana add a quote by Hunter S. Thompson
item.description: "There are times, however, and this is one of them, when even being right feels wrong. What do you say, for instance, about a generation that has been taught that rain is poison and sex is death? If making love might be fatal and if a cool spring breeze on any summer afternoon can turn a crystal blue lake into a puddle of black poison right in front of your eyes, there is not much left except TV and relentless masturbation. It's a strange world. Some people get rich and others eat shit and die." -- Hunter S. Thompson

item.title: Dana add a quote by Sara Teasdale
item.description: "You will recognize your own path when you come upon it because you will suddenly have all the energy and imagination you will ever need." -- Sara Teasdale

item.title: Dana add a quote by Flannery O'Connor
item.description: "Everywhere I go I'm asked if I think the university stifles writers. My opinion is that they don't stifle enough of them. There's many a best-seller that could have been prevented by a good teacher." -- Flannery O'Connor

item.title: Dana add a quote by Carl Gustav Jung
item.description: "The pendulum of the mind oscillates between sense and nonsense, not between right and wrong." -- Carl Gustav Jung

item.title: Dana add a quote by Angele Ellis
item.description: "...It is only now that memory works both ways. Which of us dreamed it - those from the country of nights five times as warm and as cold, or those who turned away and woke?" -- Angele Ellis

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "In the depth of winter, I finally learned that within me there lay an invincible summer." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "You will never be happy if you continue to search for what happiness consists of. You will never live if you are looking for the meaning of life." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Should I kill myself, or have a cup of coffee?" -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "To be born to create, to love, to win at games is to be born to live in time of peace. But war teaches us to lose everything and become what we were not. It all becomes a question of style." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Rule: Start by looking for what is valid in every man." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Give up the tyranny of female charm." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Essay on tragedy. (1) The silence of Prometheus. (2) The Elizabethans. (3) Moliere. (4) The spirit of revolt." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Dana add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "In the most complete friendship there is always a little empty space, like the space in an egg." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Dana add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "Writing is a way of talking without being interrupted." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Dana add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "As I grow to understand life less and less, I learn to love it more and more." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Dana add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "It`s not how old you are, it`s how you are old." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Dana add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "If you are afraid of being lonely, don't try to be right." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Dana add a quote by Jules Renard
item.description: "I am never bored; to be bored is an insult to one's self." -- Jules Renard

item.title: Dana add a quote by Maurice Blanchot
item.description: "A writer who writes, ''I am alone''... can be considered rather comical. It is comical for a man to recognize his solitude by addressing a reader and by using methods that prevent the individual from being alone. The word alone is just as general as the word bread. To pronounce it is to summon to oneself the presence of everything the word excludes." -- Maurice Blanchot
